2422 if( collide && collide->isSalvageCrateCollide() )
2423 {
2424 return true;
2425 }
2426 }
2427 return false;
2428}
2429
2430//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2434void Object::updateUpgradeModules()
2435{
2436 if( testStatus(OBJECT_STATUS_UNDER_CONSTRUCTION) )
2437 return; // No upgrade can run if we are under construction. The three places that clear UnderConstruction will re-update us.
2438
2439 if( testStatus( OBJECT_STATUS_DESTROYED ) )
2440 return; // Patch 1.03 -- Fixes crash when you upgrade a fake GLA command center to a real one if (toxic or demo).
2441
2442 if( getControllingPlayer() == NULL )
2443 return; // This can only happen in game teardown. No upgrades for you without a player. Weird crashes are bad.
2444
2445 UpgradeMaskType playerMask = getControllingPlayer()->getCompletedUpgradeMask();
2446 UpgradeMaskType objectMask = getObjectCompletedUpgradeMask();
2447 UpgradeMaskType maskToCheck = playerMask;
2448 maskToCheck.set( objectMask );
2449 // We need to add in all of the already owned upgrades to handle "AND" requiring upgrades.
2450 // We combine all the masks in case someone has a Object AND Player combination
2451
2452 for (BehaviorModule** module = m_behaviors; *module; ++module)
2453 {
2454 UpgradeModuleInterface* upgrade = (*module)->getUpgrade();
2455 if (!upgrade)
2456 continue;
2457
2458 if( !upgrade->isAlreadyUpgraded() )
2459 {
2460 upgrade->attemptUpgrade( maskToCheck );
2461 }
2462 }
2463}
2464
2465//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2466//This function sucks.
2467//It was added for objects that can disguise as other objects and contain upgraded subobject overrides.
2468//A concrete example is the bomb truck. Different payloads are displayed based on which upgrades have been
2469//made. When the bomb truck disguises as something else, these subobjects are lost because the vector is
2470//stored in W3DDrawModule. When we revert back to the original bomb truck, we call this function to
2471//recalculate those upgraded subobjects.
2472//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2473void Object::forceRefreshSubObjectUpgradeStatus()
2474{
2475 for (BehaviorModule** module = m_behaviors; *module; ++module)
2476 {
2477 UpgradeModuleInterface* upgrade = (*module)->getUpgrade();
2478 if (!upgrade)
2479 continue;
2480
2481 if( upgrade->isSubObjectsUpgrade() )
2482 {
2483 upgrade->forceRefreshUpgrade();
2484 }
2485 }
2486}
2487
2488//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2490//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2491Bool Object::didEnterOrExit() const
2492{
2493 if (isKindOf(KINDOF_INERT)) {
2494 return FALSE;
2495 }
2496 // note that this needs to return true if we
2497 // entered or exited on the current frame OR
2498 // the previous frame... since the current execution
2499 // order is ScriptEngine, then ObjectUpdates,
2500 // enter/exits detected in ObjectUpdate on frame N
2501 // won't be noticed by the ScriptEngine till frame N+1.
2502 UnsignedInt now = TheGameLogic->getFrame();
2503 return m_enteredOrExitedFrame == now || m_enteredOrExitedFrame == now - 1;
2504}
2505
2506//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2508//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2509Bool Object::didEnter(const PolygonTrigger *pTrigger) const
2510{
2511 if (!didEnterOrExit())
2512 return false;
2513
2514 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(!isKindOf(KINDOF_INERT), ("Asking whether an inert object entered or exited. This is invalid.\n"));
2515
2516 for (Int i=0; i<m_numTriggerAreasActive; i++)
2517 {
2518 if (m_triggerInfo[i].entered && m_triggerInfo[i].pTrigger == pTrigger)
2519 return true;
2520 }
2521 return false;
2522}
2523
2524//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2526//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2527Bool Object::didExit(const PolygonTrigger *pTrigger) const
2528{
2529 if (!didEnterOrExit())
2530 return false;
2531
2532 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(!isKindOf(KINDOF_INERT), ("Asking whether an inert object entered or exited. This is invalid.\n"));
2533 for (Int i=0; i<m_numTriggerAreasActive; i++)
2534 {
2535 if (m_triggerInfo[i].exited && m_triggerInfo[i].pTrigger == pTrigger)
2536 return true;
2537 }
2538 return false;
2539}
2540
2541//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2543//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2544Bool Object::isInside(const PolygonTrigger *pTrigger) const
2545{
2546 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(!isKindOf(KINDOF_INERT), ("Asking whether an inert is inside a trigger area. This is invalid.\n"));
2547
2548 for (Int i=0; i<m_numTriggerAreasActive; i++)
2549 {
2550 if (m_triggerInfo[i].isInside && m_triggerInfo[i].pTrigger == pTrigger)
2551 return true;
2552 }
2553 return false;
2554}
2555
2556// ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2558// ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2559ExitInterface *Object::getObjectExitInterface() const
2560{
2561 ExitInterface *exitInterface = NULL;
2562
2563 for( BehaviorModule **umod = m_behaviors; *umod; ++umod )
2564 {
2565 if( (exitInterface = (*umod)->getUpdateExitInterface()) != NULL )
2566 break;
2567 }
2568
2569 // If you don't have a fancy one, you may have one from your contain module,
2570 // since if you can contain something, they will need to get out.
2571 if( exitInterface == NULL )
2572 {
2573 ContainModuleInterface *cmod = getContain();
2574 if( cmod )
2575 {
2576 exitInterface = cmod->getContainExitInterface();
2577 }
2578 }
2579
2580 return exitInterface;
2581
2582} // end getObjectExitInterface
2583
2584//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2586//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2587void Object::setTriggerAreaFlagsForChangeInPosition()
2588{
2589 // projectiles cannot trigger areas. (jkmcd)
2590 // neither can inert objects, like the radar ping, etc. (jkmcd)
2591 if (isKindOf(KINDOF_PROJECTILE) || isKindOf(KINDOF_INERT))
2592 return;
2593
2594 ICoord3D iPos;
2595 Coord3D pos = *getPosition();
2596 iPos.x = REAL_TO_INT(pos.x);
2597 iPos.y = REAL_TO_INT(pos.y);
2598 iPos.z = 0; // Trigger areas compare on xy only.
2599 if (m_iPos.x == iPos.x && m_iPos.y == iPos.y)
2600 {
2601 return; // didn't move enough to change integer position.
2602 }
2603
2604 if (!isKindOf(KINDOF_IMMOBILE)) {
2605 if (isKindOf(KINDOF_INFANTRY) || isKindOf(KINDOF_VEHICLE) ) {
2606 TheGameClient->notifyTerrainObjectMoved(this);
2607 }
2608 }
2609
2610 if (getAIUpdateInterface())
2611 {
2612 TheAI->pathfinder()->updatePos(this, getPosition());
2613 }
2614
2615 UnsignedInt now = TheGameLogic->getFrame();
2616 if (m_enteredOrExitedFrame != 0 && m_enteredOrExitedFrame != now)
2617 updateTriggerAreaFlags();
2618
2619 // Check for exited.
2620 Int i;
2621 for (i=0; i<m_numTriggerAreasActive; i++)
2622 {
2623 if (!m_triggerInfo[i].pTrigger->pointInTrigger(m_iPos))
2624 {
2625 m_triggerInfo[i].isInside = false;
2626 m_triggerInfo[i].exited = true;
2627 m_enteredOrExitedFrame = now;
2628 if (m_team)
2629 m_team->setEnteredExited();
2630 TheGameLogic->updateObjectsChangedTriggerAreas();
2631#ifdef _DEBUG
2632 //TheScriptEngine->AppendDebugMessage("Object exited.", false);
2633#endif
2634 }
2635 }
2636
2637 m_iPos = iPos;
2638
2639 for (const PolygonTrigger *pTrig = PolygonTrigger::getFirstPolygonTrigger(); pTrig; pTrig = pTrig->getNext())
2640 {
2641 Bool skip = false;
2642 for (i = 0; i < m_numTriggerAreasActive; i++)
2643 {
2644 if (m_triggerInfo[i].pTrigger == pTrig)
2645 {
2646 // Already handled this one in the check for exited above.
2647 skip = true;
2648 break;
2649 }
2650 }
2651 if (skip)
2652 continue;
2653 if (pTrig->pointInTrigger(m_iPos))
2654 {
2655 if (m_numTriggerAreasActive < MAX_TRIGGER_AREA_INFOS)
2656 {
2657 m_triggerInfo[m_numTriggerAreasActive].isInside = true;
2658 m_triggerInfo[m_numTriggerAreasActive].entered = true;
2659 m_triggerInfo[m_numTriggerAreasActive].exited = false;
2660 m_triggerInfo[m_numTriggerAreasActive].pTrigger = pTrig;
2661 m_enteredOrExitedFrame = now;
2662 if (m_team)
2663 m_team->setEnteredExited();
2664 TheGameLogic->updateObjectsChangedTriggerAreas();
2665 ++m_numTriggerAreasActive;
2666#ifdef _DEBUG
2667 //TheScriptEngine->AppendDebugMessage("Object entered.", false);
2668#endif
2669 }
2670 else
2671 {
2672 // Shouldn't happen.
2673 static Bool didWarn = false;
2674 if (!didWarn)
2675 {
2676 didWarn = true;
2677 TheScriptEngine->AppendDebugMessage("***WARNING - Too many nested trigger areas. ***", true);
2678 }
2679 }
2680 }
2681
2682 }
2683
2684}
2685
2686
2687
2688//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2689//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2690Bool Object::isInList(Object **pListHead) const
2691{
2692 Bool result = m_prev || m_next || *pListHead == this;
2693#ifdef INTENSE_DEBUG
2694 Bool found = false;
2695 for (Object* o = *pListHead; o; o = o->m_next)
2696 {
2697 if (o == this)
2698 {
2699 found = true;
2700 break;
2701 }
2702 }
2703 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(found==result,("inconsistent links in Object::isInList"));
2704#endif
2705 return result;
2706}
2707
2708//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2709//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2710void Object::prependToList(Object **pListHead)
2711{
2712 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(!isInList(pListHead), ("obj is already in a list"));
2713
2714 m_prev = NULL;
2715 m_next = *pListHead;
2716 if (*pListHead)
2717 (*pListHead)->m_prev = this;
2718 *pListHead = this;
2719}
2720
2721//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2722//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2723void Object::setLayer(PathfindLayerEnum layer)
2724{
2725 if (layer!=m_layer) {
2726#define no_SET_LAYER_INTENSE_DEBUG
2727#ifdef SET_LAYER_INTENSE_DEBUG
2728 DEBUG_LOG(("Changing layer from %d to %d\n", m_layer, layer));
2729 if (m_layer != LAYER_GROUND) {
2730 if (TheTerrainLogic->objectInteractsWithBridgeLayer(this, m_layer)) {
2731 DEBUG_CRASH(("Probably shouldn't be chaging layer. jba."));
2732 }
2733 }
2734#endif
2735 TheAI->pathfinder()->removePos(this);
2736 m_layer = layer;
2737 TheAI->pathfinder()->updatePos(this, getPosition());
2738 }
2739}
2740
2741//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2742//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2743void Object::setDestinationLayer(PathfindLayerEnum layer)
2744{
2745 if (layer!=m_destinationLayer) {
2746 m_destinationLayer = layer;
2747 }
2748}
2749
2750// ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2752// ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2753void Object::setID( ObjectID id )
2754{
2755
2756 // sanity
2757 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH( id != INVALID_ID, ("Object::setID - Invalid id\n") );
2758
2759 // if id hasn't changed do nothing
2760 if( m_id == id )
2761 return;
2762
2763 // remove this objects previous id from the lookup table
2764 TheGameLogic->removeObjectFromLookupTable( this );
2765
2766 // assign new id
2767 m_id = id;
2768
2769 // add new id to lookup table
2770 TheGameLogic->addObjectToLookupTable( this );
2771
2772} // end setID
2773
2774// ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2775Real Object::calculateHeightAboveTerrain(void) const
2776{
2777 const Coord3D* pos = getPosition();
2778 Real terrainZ = TheTerrainLogic->getLayerHeight( pos->x, pos->y, m_layer );
2779 Real myZ = pos->z;
2780 return myZ - terrainZ;
2781}
2782
2783//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2784//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2785void Object::removeFromList(Object **pListHead)
2786{
2787 if (m_next)
2788 m_next->m_prev = m_prev;
2789
2790 if (m_prev)
2791 m_prev->m_next = m_next;
2792 else
2793 *pListHead = m_next;
2794
2795 m_prev = NULL;
2796 m_next = NULL;
2797}
2798
2799//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2800//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2801void Object::friend_prepareForMapBoundaryAdjust(void)
2802{
2803 // NOTE - DO NOT remove from pathfind map. jba.
2804 // NO NO. jba. TheAI->pathfinder()->removeObjectFromPathfindMap( this );
2805
2806 // remove from the radar, remove from the partition manager
2807 TheRadar->removeObject(this);
2808 ThePartitionManager->unRegisterObject(this);
2809
2810 // The whole PartitionManager and all of the Looker data is about to be blown away,
2811 // so forget what I think I have done
2812 m_partitionLastLook->reset();
2813 m_partitionRevealAllLastLook->reset();
2814 m_partitionLastShroud->reset();
2815
2816 m_partitionLastThreat->reset();
2817 m_partitionLastValue->reset();
2818
2819}
2820
2821//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2822//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2823void Object::friend_notifyOfNewMapBoundary(void)
2824{
2825 ThePartitionManager->registerObject(this);
2826 TheRadar->addObject(this);
2827 TheAI->pathfinder()->addObjectToPathfindMap( this );
2828
2829 // Now that the PartitionManager has finished its reset, we need to relook
2830 handlePartitionCellMaintenance();
2831
2832 Region3D mapExtent;
2833 TheTerrainLogic->getExtent(&mapExtent);
2834 if (mapExtent.isInRegionNoZ(getPosition()))
2835 m_privateStatus &= ~OFF_MAP;
2836 else
2837 m_privateStatus |= OFF_MAP;
2838}
2839
2840
2841//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2842//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2843void Object::calcNaturalRallyPoint(Coord2D *pt)
2844{
2845 const Matrix3D *transform = getTransformMatrix();
2846 Vector3 v;
2847
2848 //
2849 // get the natural rally point from the template, this coord is in model space relative
2850 // to the model (0,0,0)
2851 //
2852/*
2853 const Coord3D *naturalRallyPoint;
2854 naturalRallyPoint = m_template->getNaturalRallyPoint();
2855 v.X = naturalRallyPoint->x;
2856 v.Y = naturalRallyPoint->y;
2857 v.Z = naturalRallyPoint->z;
2858*/
2859 v.Set( 0, 0, 0 );
2860
2861 // transform the point into world space
2862 transform->Transform_Vector( *transform, v, &v );
2863
2864 // we're only concerned with the 2D elements for now
2865 pt->x = v.X;
2866 pt->y = v.Y;
2867
2868}
2869
2870//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2871Module* Object::findModule(NameKeyType key) const
2872{
2873 Module* m = NULL;
2874
2875 for (BehaviorModule** b = m_behaviors; *b; ++b)
2876 {
2877 if ((*b)->getModuleNameKey() == key)
2878 {
2879#ifdef INTENSE_DEBUG
2880 if (m == NULL)
2881 {
2882 m = *b;
2883 }
2884 else
2885 {
2886 DEBUG_CRASH(("Duplicate modules found for name %s!\n",TheNameKeyGenerator->keyToName(key).str()));
2887 }
2888#else
2889 m = *b;
2890 break;
2891#endif
2892 }
2893 }
2894
2895 return m;
2896}
2897
2898//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2902Bool Object::isMobile() const
2903{
2904 if (isKindOf(KINDOF_IMMOBILE))
2905 return false;
2906
2907 if( isDisabled() )
2908 return false;
2909
2910 return true;
2911}
2912
2913//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2914void Object::scoreTheKill( const Object *victim )
2915{
2916 // Do stuff that has nothing to do with experience points here, like tell our Player we killed something
2918
2919 Player* victimController = victim->getControllingPlayer();
2920 // if the other player is not a playable side (i.e. they are civilian, observer, whatever)
2921 // we shouldn't count the kill.
2922 if (victimController->isPlayableSide() == FALSE)
2923 {
2924 return;
2925 }
2926
2927
2928 if ( victim->isKindOf( KINDOF_IGNORED_IN_GUI ) )
2929 return;
2930
2931
2932 Player* controller = getControllingPlayer();
2933
2934 if (victimController)
2935 {
2936 victimController->getScoreKeeper()->addObjectLost(victim);
2937 }
2938
2939 Relationship r = getRelationship(victim);
2940 if (r != ENEMIES)
2941 return;
2942
2943 // Don't count kills that I do on my own buildings or units, cause thats just silly.
2944 if (controller == victimController)
2945 {
2946 return;
2947 }
2948
2949 if (controller)
2950 {
2951 controller->getScoreKeeper()->addObjectDestroyed(victim);
2952 controller->addSkillPointsForKill(this, victim);
2953 controller->doBountyForKill(this, victim);
2954 }
2955
2956 // Now handle experience, if we can gain any
2957 if (m_experienceTracker && m_experienceTracker->isAcceptingExperiencePoints())
2958 {
2959 // srj sez: per dustin, no experience (et al) for killing things under construction.
2960 if (!victim->testStatus(OBJECT_STATUS_UNDER_CONSTRUCTION))
2961 {
2962 Int experienceValue = victim->getExperienceTracker()->getExperienceValue( this );
2963 getExperienceTracker()->addExperiencePoints( experienceValue );
2964 }
2965 }
2966}
2967
2968//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2969VeterancyLevel Object::getVeterancyLevel() const
2970{
2971 return m_experienceTracker ? m_experienceTracker->getVeterancyLevel() : LEVEL_REGULAR;
2972}
2973
2974//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2975void Object::friend_bindToDrawable( Drawable *draw )
2976{
2977 m_drawable = draw;
2978 if (m_drawable)
2979 {
2980 ModelConditionFlags set;
2981 ModelConditionFlags clr;
2982 for (int i = 0; i < WEAPONSET_COUNT; ++i)
2983 {
2984 ModelConditionFlagType mcs = TheWeaponSetTypeToModelConditionTypeMap[i];
2985 if( mcs != MODELCONDITION_INVALID )
2986 {
2987 if (m_curWeaponSetFlags.test(i))
2988 set.set(mcs);
2989 else
2990 clr.set(mcs);
2991 }
2992 }
2993 if (TheGlobalData)
2994 {
2995 if (TheGlobalData->m_forceModelsToFollowTimeOfDay)
2996 {
2997 set.set(MODELCONDITION_NIGHT, (TheGlobalData->m_timeOfDay == TIME_OF_DAY_NIGHT) ? 1 : 0);
2998 }
2999
3000 if (TheGlobalData->m_forceModelsToFollowWeather)
3001 {
3002 set.set(MODELCONDITION_SNOW, (TheGlobalData->m_weather == WEATHER_SNOWY) ? 1 : 0);
3003 }
3004 }
3005 m_drawable->clearAndSetModelConditionFlags(clr, set);
3006 }
3007
3008 for (BehaviorModule** b = m_behaviors; *b; ++b)
3009 {
3010 (*b)->onDrawableBoundToObject();
3011 }
3012}
3013
3014//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3015void Object::setSelectable(Bool selectable)
3016{
3017 m_isSelectable = selectable;
3018 if (m_drawable)
3019 {
3020 m_drawable->setSelectable(selectable);
3021 }
3022}
3023
3024//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3025Bool Object::isSelectable() const
3026{
3027// return getTemplate()->isKindOf(KINDOF_ALWAYS_SELECTABLE)
3028// || (m_isSelectable
3029// && !testStatus(OBJECT_STATUS_UNSELECTABLE)
3030// && !isEffectivelyDead()
3031// && !getTemplate()->isKindOf(KINDOF_DRONE)//Most drones are unselectable from being slaved, but the SpyDrone needs help
3032// );
3033
3034
3035 if (getTemplate()->isKindOf(KINDOF_ALWAYS_SELECTABLE))
3036 return TRUE;
3037
3038 if ( m_isSelectable )
3039 if ( !testStatus(OBJECT_STATUS_UNSELECTABLE) )
3040 if ( !isEffectivelyDead() )
3041 //if ( !getTemplate()->isKindOf(KINDOF_DRONE) )//Most drones are unselectable from being slaved, but the SpyDrone needs help
3042 return TRUE;
3043
3044 return FALSE;
3045}
3046
3047//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3048Bool Object::isMassSelectable() const
3049{
3050 return isSelectable() && !isKindOf(KINDOF_STRUCTURE);
3051}
3052
3053//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3054void Object::setWeaponSetFlag(WeaponSetType wst)
3055{
3056 m_curWeaponSetFlags.set(wst);
3057 m_weaponSet.updateWeaponSet(this);
3058 if (m_drawable)
3059 {
3060 m_drawable->setModelConditionState(TheWeaponSetTypeToModelConditionTypeMap[wst]);
3061 }
3062}
3063
3064//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3065void Object::clearWeaponSetFlag(WeaponSetType wst)
3066{
3067 m_curWeaponSetFlags.set(wst, 0);
3068 m_weaponSet.updateWeaponSet(this);
3069 if (m_drawable)
3070 {
3071 m_drawable->clearModelConditionState(TheWeaponSetTypeToModelConditionTypeMap[wst]);
3072 }
3073}
3074
3075//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3076Bool Object::hasSpecialPower( SpecialPowerType type ) const
3077{
3078 return TEST_SPECIALPOWERMASK( m_specialPowerBits, type );
3079}
3080
3081//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3082Bool Object::hasAnySpecialPower() const
3083{
3084 return SPECIALPOWERMASK_ANY_SET( m_specialPowerBits );
3085}
3086
3087//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3088void Object::onVeterancyLevelChanged( VeterancyLevel oldLevel, VeterancyLevel newLevel, Bool provideFeedback )
3089{
3090 updateUpgradeModules();
3091
3092 const UpgradeTemplate* up = TheUpgradeCenter->findVeterancyUpgrade(newLevel);
3093 if (up)
3094 giveUpgrade(up);
3095
3096 BodyModuleInterface* body = getBodyModule();
3097 if (body)
3098 body->onVeterancyLevelChanged( oldLevel, newLevel, provideFeedback );
3099
3100 Bool hideAnimationForStealth = FALSE;
3101 if( !isLocallyControlled() &&
3102 testStatus( OBJECT_STATUS_STEALTHED ) &&
3103 !testStatus( OBJECT_STATUS_DETECTED ) &&
3104 !testStatus( OBJECT_STATUS_DISGUISED ) )
3105 {
3106 hideAnimationForStealth = TRUE;
3107 }
3108
3109 Bool doAnimation = ( ! hideAnimationForStealth
3110 && (newLevel > oldLevel)
3111 && ( ! isKindOf(KINDOF_IGNORED_IN_GUI))); //First, we plan to do the animation if the level went up
3112
3113 switch (newLevel)
3114 {
3115 case LEVEL_REGULAR:
3116 clearWeaponSetFlag(WEAPONSET_VETERAN);
3117 clearWeaponSetFlag(WEAPONSET_ELITE);
3118 clearWeaponSetFlag(WEAPONSET_HERO);
3119 clearWeaponBonusCondition(WEAPONBONUSCONDITION_VETERAN);
3120 clearWeaponBonusCondition(WEAPONBONUSCONDITION_ELITE);
3121 clearWeaponBonusCondition(WEAPONBONUSCONDITION_HERO);
3122 doAnimation = FALSE;//... but not if somehow up to Regular
3123 break;
3124 case LEVEL_VETERAN:
3125 setWeaponSetFlag(WEAPONSET_VETERAN);
3126 clearWeaponSetFlag(WEAPONSET_ELITE);
3127 clearWeaponSetFlag(WEAPONSET_HERO);
3128 setWeaponBonusCondition(WEAPONBONUSCONDITION_VETERAN);
3129 clearWeaponBonusCondition(WEAPONBONUSCONDITION_ELITE);
3130 clearWeaponBonusCondition(WEAPONBONUSCONDITION_HERO);
3131 break;
3132 case LEVEL_ELITE:
3133 clearWeaponSetFlag(WEAPONSET_VETERAN);
3134 setWeaponSetFlag(WEAPONSET_ELITE);
3135 clearWeaponSetFlag(WEAPONSET_HERO);
3136 clearWeaponBonusCondition(WEAPONBONUSCONDITION_VETERAN);
3137 setWeaponBonusCondition(WEAPONBONUSCONDITION_ELITE);
3138 clearWeaponBonusCondition(WEAPONBONUSCONDITION_HERO);
3139 break;
3140 case LEVEL_HEROIC:
3141 clearWeaponSetFlag(WEAPONSET_VETERAN);
3142 clearWeaponSetFlag(WEAPONSET_ELITE);
3143 setWeaponSetFlag(WEAPONSET_HERO);
3144 clearWeaponBonusCondition(WEAPONBONUSCONDITION_VETERAN);
3145 clearWeaponBonusCondition(WEAPONBONUSCONDITION_ELITE);
3146 setWeaponBonusCondition(WEAPONBONUSCONDITION_HERO);
3147 break;
3148 }
3149
3150 if( doAnimation && TheGameLogic->getDrawIconUI() && provideFeedback )
3151 {
3152 if( TheAnim2DCollection && TheGlobalData->m_levelGainAnimationName.isEmpty() == FALSE )
3153 {
3154 Anim2DTemplate *animTemplate = TheAnim2DCollection->findTemplate( TheGlobalData->m_levelGainAnimationName );
3155
3156 Coord3D pos = *getPosition();
3157 pos.add(&m_healthBoxOffset);
3158
3159 TheInGameUI->addWorldAnimation( animTemplate,
3160 &pos,
3161 WORLD_ANIM_FADE_ON_EXPIRE,
3162 TheGlobalData->m_levelGainAnimationDisplayTimeInSeconds,
3163 TheGlobalData->m_levelGainAnimationZRisePerSecond);
3164 }
3165
3166 AudioEventRTS soundToPlay = TheAudio->getMiscAudio()->m_unitPromoted;
3167 soundToPlay.setObjectID( getID() );
3168 TheAudio->addAudioEvent( &soundToPlay );
3169 }
3170
3171}
3172
3173//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3177Bool Object::isAbleToAttack() const
3178{
3179
3180 //******************************************************
3181 //********* AUTOMATICALLY FALSE CONDITIONS *************
3182 //******************************************************
3183
3184 // For things that may or may not be able to normally attack, but are under a status condition
3185 if( getStatusBits().test( OBJECT_STATUS_NO_ATTACK ) )
3186 return false;
3187
3188 // if we're contained within a transport we cannot attack unless it specifically allows us
3189 const Object *containedBy = getContainedBy();
3190 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH( (containedBy == NULL) || (containedBy->getContain() != NULL), ("A %s thinks they are contained by something with no contain module!", getTemplate()->getName().str() ) );
3191 if( containedBy && containedBy->getContain() && !containedBy->getContain()->isPassengerAllowedToFire( getID() ) )
3192 return false;
3193
3194
3195 // We can't fire if under construction
3196 if( testStatus(OBJECT_STATUS_UNDER_CONSTRUCTION) )
3197 return false;
3198
3199 // or being sold
3200 if( testStatus(OBJECT_STATUS_SOLD) )
3201 return false;
3202
3203 if ( isDisabledByType( DISABLED_SUBDUED ) )
3204 return FALSE; // A Microwave Tank is cooking me
3205
3206 //We can't fire if we, as a portable structure, are aptly disabled
3207 if ( isKindOf( KINDOF_PORTABLE_STRUCTURE ) || isKindOf( KINDOF_SPAWNS_ARE_THE_WEAPONS ))
3208 {
3209 if( isDisabledByType( DISABLED_HACKED ) || isDisabledByType( DISABLED_EMP ) )
3210 return false;
3211
3212 if ( isKindOf( KINDOF_INFANTRY ) ) // I must be a stinger soldier or similar
3213 {
3214 for (BehaviorModule** update = getBehaviorModules(); *update; ++update)//expensive search, limited only to stinger soldiers
3215 {
3216 SlavedUpdateInterface* sdu = (*update)->getSlavedUpdateInterface();
3217 if ( sdu )
3218 {
3219 ObjectID slaverID = sdu->getSlaverID();
3220 if ( slaverID != INVALID_ID )
3221 {
3222 Object *slaver = TheGameLogic->findObjectByID( slaverID );
3223 if ( slaver && slaver->isDisabledByType( DISABLED_SUBDUED ))
3224 return FALSE;// if my stinger site is subdued, so am I
3225 }
3226
3227 break;//only expect one slavedupdate, so stop searching
3228 }
3229 }
3230 }
3231
3232
3233 }
3234
3235
3236
3237 //We can't fire if all our weapons are disabled!
3238 //Currently, only turreted weapons can be disabled.
3239 //ONLY DO THIS CHECK IF OUR UNIT DOESN'T HAVE THE
3240 //KINDOF_CAN_ATTACK flag... nuke cannons have disabled
3241 //turrets when not deployed, and need to be able to attack to deploy!
3242 //Strategy centers can't attack when bombardment isn't active!
3243 Bool anyEnabled = FALSE;
3244 Bool anyWeapon = FALSE;
3245 const AIUpdateInterface *ai = getAI();
3246 if( ai && !isKindOf( KINDOF_CAN_ATTACK ) )
3247 {
3248 for( Int i = 0; i < WEAPONSLOT_COUNT; i++ )
3249 {
3250 //Find the weapon in this slot.
3251 Weapon* weapon = getWeaponInWeaponSlot( (WeaponSlotType)i );
3252 if( !weapon )
3253 continue;
3254
3255 anyWeapon = TRUE;
3256
3257 //We found a weapon, is it a turret?
3258 Real dummy;
3259 WhichTurretType tur = ai->getWhichTurretForWeaponSlot( (WeaponSlotType)i, &dummy );
3260 if( tur == TURRET_INVALID )
3261 {
3262 //Currently impossible to disable a non-turreted weapon, so we
3263 //have a non turreted weapon that is enabled. Quit.
3264 anyEnabled = TRUE;
3265 break;
3266 }
3267
3268 if( ai->isTurretEnabled( tur ) )
3269 {
3270 //The turret is enable, meaning we have an enabled weapon. Quit.
3271 anyEnabled = TRUE;
3272 break;;
3273 }
3274 }
3275 if( anyWeapon && !anyEnabled )
3276 {
3277 //We failed to find any active weapons.
3278 return FALSE;
3279 }
3280 }
3281
3282
3283 //***************************************
3284 //********* TRUE CONDITIONS *************
3285 //***************************************
3286
3287 // for certain buildings
3288 if (isKindOf(KINDOF_CAN_ATTACK))
3289 return true;
3290
3291 // for garrisonned buildings that can attack sometimes
3292 if( getStatusBits().test( OBJECT_STATUS_CAN_ATTACK ) )
3293 return true;
3294
3295 // for weaponless transports. This will make me think I can, but I will check if I literally can by looking
3296 // at passenger weapons in CanAttack.
3297 const ContainModuleInterface* contain = getContain();
3298 if( contain && contain->isPassengerAllowedToFire( getID() ) && contain->getContainCount() > 0 )
3299 return true;
3300
3301 // if we have AI and a weapon, assume we know how to use it
3302 if (getAIUpdateInterface() != NULL && m_weaponSet.hasAnyWeapon())
3303 {
3304
3305// actually, we don't want to do this; we want the troop crawler to be considered "able to attack"
3306// even if empty, so sayeth Dustin. (srj)
3307// // special case: if the only damage we do is DEPLOY, we must have some guys contained.
3308// if (m_weaponSet.hasSingleDamageType(DAMAGE_DEPLOY))
3309// {
3310// return contain->getContainCount() > 0;
3311// }
3312// else
3313 {
3314 return true;
3315 }
3316 }
3317
3318 SpawnBehaviorInterface *spawnInterface = getSpawnBehaviorInterface();
3319 if( spawnInterface )
3320 {
3321 if( spawnInterface->canAnySlavesAttack() )
3322 {
3323 return TRUE;
3324 }
3325 }
3326
3327 if (getTemplate()->isEnterGuard())
3328 return TRUE;
3329
3330//Default is no
3331 return false;
3332}
3333
3334//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3338void Object::maskObject( Bool mask )
3339{
3340
3341 // set or clear the mask bit
3342 setStatus( MAKE_OBJECT_STATUS_MASK( OBJECT_STATUS_MASKED ), mask );
3343
3344 //
3345 // when masking objects they become unselected ... we do this in any situation for
3346 // any player cause you aren't allowed to select masked objects, if the object is not
3347 // selected (ie, belongs to another player) it's no big deal cause it won't be selected
3348 // anyway
3349 //
3350
3351 if (mask)
3352 TheGameLogic->deselectObject(this, ~getControllingPlayer()->getPlayerMask(), TRUE);
3353
3354} // end maskObject
3355
3356//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3357/*
3358 * returns true if the current locomotor is an airborne one
3359 */
3360Bool Object::isUsingAirborneLocomotor( void ) const
3361{
3362 return ( m_ai && m_ai->getCurLocomotor() && ((m_ai->getCurLocomotor()->getLegalSurfaces() & LOCOMOTORSURFACE_AIR) != 0) );
3363}
3364
3365//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3366//THIS FUNCTION BELONGS AT THE OBJECT LEVEL BECAUSE THERE IS AT LEAST ONE SPECIAL UNIT
3367//(ANGRY MOB) WHICH NEEDS LOGIC-SIDE POSITION CALC'S...
3368//IT WOULD PROBABLY BE WISE TO MOVE ALL THE HARD-CODED DEFAULTS BELOW
3369//INTO A NEW Drawable::getHealthBox..() WHICH USES GEOM0INFO, MODEL DATA, INI DATA, ETC.
3370void Object::getHealthBoxPosition(Coord3D& pos) const
3371{
3372 pos = *getPosition();
3373 pos.z += getGeometryInfo().getMaxHeightAbovePosition() + 10;
3374 pos.add(&m_healthBoxOffset);
3375
3376 // this needs to get moved to the mobspawnerupdate
3377 if (isKindOf(KINDOF_MOB_NEXUS)) // quicker idiot test
3378 {
3379 pos.z += 20;// dear God, I confess my kluge, and repent.
3380 }
3381}
3382
3383//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3384//THIS FUNCTION BELONGS AT THE OBJECT LEVEL BECAUSE THERE IS AT LEAST ONE SPECIAL UNIT
3385//(ANGRY MOB) WHICH NEEDS LOGIC-SIDE POSITION CALC'S...
3386//IT WOULD PROBABLY BE WISE TO MOVE ALL THE HARD-CODED DEFAULTS BELOW
3387//INTO A NEW Drawable::getHealthBox..() WHICH USES GEOM0INFO, MODEL DATA, INI DATA, ETC.
3388Bool Object::getHealthBoxDimensions(Real &healthBoxHeight, Real &healthBoxWidth) const
3389{
3390
3391#ifdef CALC_HEALTHBAR_FROM_HITPOINTS
3392 Real maxHP = getBodyModule()->getMaxHealth();
3393
3394 if( isKindOf( KINDOF_STRUCTURE ) )
3395 {
3396 //enforce healthBoxHeightMinimum/Maximum
3397 healthBoxHeight = min(3.0f, max(5.0f, maxHP/50));
3398 //enforce healthBoxWidthMinimum/Maximum
3399 healthBoxWidth = min(150.0f, max(100.0f, maxHP/10));
3400 return true;
3401 }
3402 else if ( isKindOf(KINDOF_MOB_NEXUS) )
3403 {
3404 //enforce healthBoxHeightMinimum/Maximum
3405 healthBoxHeight = min(3.0f, max(5.0f, maxHP/50));
3406 //enforce healthBoxWidthMinimum/Maximum
3407 healthBoxWidth = min(100.0f, max(66.0f, maxHP/10));
3408 return true;
3409 }
3410 else if ( isKindOf( KINDOF_IGNORED_IN_GUI ) )
3411 {
3412 healthBoxHeight = 0;
3413 healthBoxWidth = 0;
3414 return false;
3415 }
3416 else
3417 {
3418 //enforce healthBoxHeightMinimum/Maximum
3419 healthBoxHeight = min(3.0f, max(5.0f, maxHP/50));
3420 //enforce healthBoxWidthMinimum/Maximum
3421 healthBoxWidth = min(150.0f, max(35.0f, maxHP/10));
3422 return true;
3423 }
3424#else
3425
3426 if ( isKindOf( KINDOF_IGNORED_IN_GUI ) )
3427 {
3428 healthBoxHeight = 0;
3429 healthBoxWidth = 0;
3430 return false;
3431 }
3432
3433 //just add the major and minor axes
3434 Real size = MAX(20.0f, MIN(150.0f, (getGeometryInfo().getMajorRadius() + getGeometryInfo().getMinorRadius())) );
3435 healthBoxHeight = 3.0f;
3436 healthBoxWidth = MAX(20.0f, size * 2.0f);
3437 return TRUE;
3438
3439#endif
3440
3441}
3442
3443
3444//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3449void Object::updateObjValuesFromMapProperties(Dict* properties)
3450{
3451 Bool exists;
3452
3453 AsciiString valStr;
3454 Bool valBool = false;
3455 Int valInt = 0;
3456 Real valReal = 0.0f;
3457
3458 valStr = properties->getAsciiString(TheKey_objectName, &exists);
3459 if (exists) {
3460 setName(valStr);
3461 }
3462
3463 valInt = properties->getInt(TheKey_objectMaxHPs, &exists);
3464 if (exists && valInt >= 0) {
3465 BodyModuleInterface* body = getBodyModule();
3466 if (body) {
3467 body->setMaxHealth(valInt);
3468 }
3469 }
3470
3471 valInt = properties->getInt(TheKey_objectInitialHealth, &exists);
3472 if (exists) {
3473 BodyModuleInterface* body = getBodyModule();
3474 if (body) {
3475 body->setInitialHealth(valInt);
3476 }
3477 }
3478
3479 // set the veterancy level
3480 valInt = properties->getInt(TheKey_objectVeterancy, &exists);
3481 if (exists) {
3482 if (m_experienceTracker && m_experienceTracker->isTrainable())
3483 {
3484 m_experienceTracker->setVeterancyLevel((VeterancyLevel)valInt);
3485 }
3486 }
3487
3488 // set the aggressiveness/mood
3489 valInt = properties->getInt(TheKey_objectAggressiveness, &exists);
3490 if (exists) {
3491 AIUpdateInterface *ai = getAIUpdateInterface();
3492 if (ai)
3493 {
3494 ai->setAttitude((AttitudeType)valInt);
3495 }
3496 }
3497
3498 // set recruitable
3499 valBool = properties->getBool(TheKey_objectRecruitableAI, &exists);
3500 if (exists) {
3501 if (getAIUpdateInterface())
3502 {
3503 getAIUpdateInterface()->setIsRecruitable(valBool);
3504 }
3505 }
3506
3507 // set selectable
3508 valBool = properties->getBool(TheKey_objectSelectable, &exists);
3509 if (exists) {
3510 if (valBool != isSelectable()) {
3511 setSelectable(valBool);
3512 }
3513 }
3514
3515 // set the stopping distance
3516 valReal = properties->getReal(TheKey_objectStoppingDistance, &exists);
3517 if (exists && valReal >= 0.5f)
3518 {
3519 if (getAIUpdateInterface() && getAIUpdateInterface()->getCurLocomotor())
3520 {
3521 Locomotor *loco = getAIUpdateInterface()->getCurLocomotor();
3522 loco->setCloseEnoughDist(valReal);
3523 }
3524 }
3525
3526 // set the disabledness of this object
3527 valBool = properties->getBool(TheKey_objectEnabled, &exists);
3528 if (exists) {
3529 setScriptStatus(OBJECT_STATUS_SCRIPT_DISABLED, !valBool);
3530 }
3531
3532 // set the disabledness of this object
3533 valBool = properties->getBool(TheKey_objectPowered, &exists);
3534 if (exists) {
3535 setScriptStatus(OBJECT_STATUS_SCRIPT_UNPOWERED, !valBool);
3536 }
3537
3538 // set the invulnerability of the object
3539 valBool = properties->getBool(TheKey_objectIndestructible, &exists);
3540 if (exists) {
3541 BodyModuleInterface* body = getBodyModule();
3542 if (body) {
3543 body->setIndestructible(valBool);
3544 }
3545 }
3546
3547 // set the sellability of the object
3548 valBool = properties->getBool(TheKey_objectUnsellable, &exists);
3549 if (exists) {
3550 setScriptStatus(OBJECT_STATUS_SCRIPT_UNSELLABLE, valBool);
3551 }
3552
3553 //Set the player targetable setting of the object
3554 valBool = properties->getBool( TheKey_objectTargetable, &exists );
3555 if( exists )
3556 {
3557 setScriptStatus(OBJECT_STATUS_SCRIPT_TARGETABLE, valBool);
3558 }
3559
3560 // adjust the vision distance of this object, overriding its default vision distance
3561 valInt = properties->getInt(TheKey_objectVisualRange, &exists);
3562 if (exists)
3563 {
3564 if (valInt < 0)
3565 valInt = 0;
3566 m_visionRange = INT_TO_REAL(valInt);
3567 }
3568
3569 // adjust the shroud clearing distance of this object, overriding its default distance
3570 valInt = properties->getInt(TheKey_objectShroudClearingDistance, &exists);
3571 if (exists)
3572 {
3573 if (valInt < 0)
3574 valInt = 0.0f;
3575 m_shroudClearingRange = INT_TO_REAL(valInt);
3576 }
3577
3578
3579 Int upgradeNum = 0;
3580 do
3581 {
3582 AsciiString keyName;
3583 keyName.format("%s%d", TheNameKeyGenerator->keyToName(TheKey_objectGrantUpgrade).str(), upgradeNum);
3584 valStr = properties->getAsciiString(NAMEKEY(keyName), &exists);
3585
3586 if (exists)
3587 {
3588 const UpgradeTemplate *ut = TheUpgradeCenter->findUpgrade(valStr);
3589 if (ut)
3590 giveUpgrade(ut);
3591 }
3592 else
3593 {
3594 valStr.clear();
3595 }
3596
3597 ++upgradeNum;
3598 } while (!valStr.isEmpty());
3599
3600 Drawable *drawable = getDrawable();
3601 if ( drawable )
3602 {
3603 valInt = properties->getInt(TheKey_objectTime, &exists);
3604 if (exists)
3605 {
3606 switch (valInt)
3607 {
3608 case 1:
3609 drawable->clearModelConditionState(MODELCONDITION_NIGHT);
3610 break;
3611 case 2:
3612 drawable->setModelConditionState(MODELCONDITION_NIGHT);
3613 break;
3614 default:
3615 break;
3616 }
3617 }
3618
3619 valInt = properties->getInt(TheKey_objectWeather, &exists);
3620 if (exists)
3621 {
3622 switch (valInt)
3623 {
3624 case 1:
3625 drawable->clearModelConditionState(MODELCONDITION_SNOW);
3626 break;
3627 case 2:
3628 drawable->setModelConditionState(MODELCONDITION_SNOW);
3629 break;
3630 default:
3631 break;
3632 }
3633 }
3634
3635 // See if we are supposed to playing the ambient sound
3636 Bool soundEnabledExists;
3637 Bool soundEnabled = properties->getBool( TheKey_objectSoundAmbientEnabled, &soundEnabledExists );
3638
3639 DynamicAudioEventInfo * audioToModify = NULL;
3640 Bool infoModified = false;
3641 valStr = properties->getAsciiString( TheKey_objectSoundAmbient, &exists );
3642 if ( exists )
3643 {
3644 if ( valStr.isEmpty() )
3645 {
3646 drawable->setCustomSoundAmbientOff();
3647 soundEnabledExists = true;
3648 soundEnabled = false; // Don't bother trying to enable later
3649 }
3650 else
3651 {
3652 const AudioEventInfo * baseInfo = TheAudio->findAudioEventInfo( valStr );
3653 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH( baseInfo != NULL, ("Cannot find customized ambient sound '%s'", valStr.str() ) );
3654 if ( baseInfo != NULL )
3655 {
3656 audioToModify = newInstance( DynamicAudioEventInfo )( *baseInfo );
3657 infoModified = true;
3658 }
3659 }
3660 }
3661
3662 // Don't do anything more to audio if we forced the ambient sound off
3663 if ( !( exists && valStr.isEmpty() ) )
3664 {
3665 valBool = properties->getBool( TheKey_objectSoundAmbientCustomized, &exists );
3666 if ( exists && valBool )
3667 {
3668 if ( audioToModify == NULL )
3669 {
3670 const AudioEventInfo * baseInfo = drawable->getBaseSoundAmbientInfo( );
3671 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH( baseInfo != NULL, ("getBaseSoundAmbientInfo() return NULL" ) );
3672 if ( baseInfo != NULL )
3673 {
3674 audioToModify = newInstance( DynamicAudioEventInfo )( *baseInfo );
3675 }
3676 }
3677
3678 if ( audioToModify != NULL )
3679 {
3680 valBool = properties->getBool( TheKey_objectSoundAmbientLooping, &exists );
3681 if ( exists )
3682 {
3683 audioToModify->overrideLoopFlag( valBool );
3684 infoModified = true;
3685 }
3686
3687 valInt = properties->getInt( TheKey_objectSoundAmbientLoopCount, &exists );
3688 if ( exists && BitTest( audioToModify->m_control, AC_LOOP ) )
3689 {
3690 audioToModify->overrideLoopCount( valInt );
3691 infoModified = true;
3692 }
3693
3694 valReal = properties->getReal( TheKey_objectSoundAmbientMinVolume, &exists );
3695 if ( exists )
3696 {
3697 audioToModify->overrideMinVolume( valReal );
3698 infoModified = true;
3699 }
3700
3701 valReal = properties->getReal( TheKey_objectSoundAmbientVolume, &exists );
3702 if ( exists )
3703 {
3704 audioToModify->overrideVolume( valReal );
3705 infoModified = true;
3706 }
3707
3708 valReal = properties->getReal( TheKey_objectSoundAmbientMinRange, &exists );
3709 if ( exists )
3710 {
3711 audioToModify->overrideMinRange( valReal );
3712 infoModified = true;
3713 }
3714
3715 valReal = properties->getReal( TheKey_objectSoundAmbientMaxRange, &exists );
3716 if ( exists )
3717 {
3718 audioToModify->overrideMaxRange( valReal );
3719 infoModified = true;
3720 }
3721
3722 valInt = properties->getInt( TheKey_objectSoundAmbientPriority, &exists );
3723 if ( exists )
3724 {
3725 audioToModify->overridePriority ( (AudioPriority)valInt );
3726 infoModified = true;
3727 }
3728 }
3729 }
3730 }
3731
3732 if ( !soundEnabledExists )
3733 {
3734 // Decide if the sound should start enabled or not, since the map maker didn't record
3735 // a preference. Enable permanently looping sounds, disable one-shot sounds by default
3736 // NOTE: This test should match the tests done in MapObjectProps::mapObjectPageSound::dictToEnabled()
3737 // when it decided whether or not to show a customized sound as enabled
3738 if ( audioToModify != NULL )
3739 {
3740 soundEnabled = audioToModify->isPermanentSound();
3741 soundEnabledExists = true; // To get into enableAmbientSoundFromScript() call.
3742 }
3743 else
3744 {
3745 // Use default audio
3746 const AudioEventInfo * baseInfo = drawable->getBaseSoundAmbientInfo( );
3747 if ( baseInfo != NULL )
3748 {
3749 soundEnabled = baseInfo->isPermanentSound();
3750 soundEnabledExists = true; // To get into enableAmbientSoundFromScript() call.
3751 }
3752 }
3753 }
3754
3755 if ( soundEnabledExists && !soundEnabled )
3756 {
3757 // Make sure sound doesn't start playing when we set it
3758 // ...FromScript because this is also controlled by the map designer not the game logic
3759 drawable->enableAmbientSoundFromScript( false );
3760 }
3761
3762 if ( infoModified && audioToModify != NULL )
3763 {
3764 // Give a custom, level-specific name
3765 drawable->mangleCustomAudioName( audioToModify );
3766
3767 // Pass to TheAudio
3768 TheAudio->addAudioEventInfo( audioToModify );
3769
3770 drawable->setCustomSoundAmbientInfo( audioToModify );
3771 audioToModify = NULL; // Belongs to TheAudio now
3772 }
3773
3774 if ( audioToModify != NULL )
3775 {
3776 audioToModify->deleteInstance();
3777 audioToModify = NULL;
3778 }
3779
3780 if ( soundEnabledExists && soundEnabled )
3781 {
3782 // Play sound now that it is set up, if needed. Don't call if already enabled because that
3783 // can cause sound to play twice
3784 // ...FromScript because this is also controlled by the map designer not the game logic
3785 if ( !drawable->getAmbientSoundEnabledFromScript() )
3786 {
3787 drawable->enableAmbientSoundFromScript( true );
3788 }
3789 }
3790 }
3791}
3792
3793//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3794void Object::friend_adjustPowerForPlayer( Bool incoming )
3795{
3796 if (isDisabled() && getTemplate()->getEnergyProduction() > 0)
3797 {
3798 // Disabledness only affects Producers, not Consumers.
3799 return;
3800 }
3801
3802 if (incoming) {
3803 getControllingPlayer()->getEnergy()->objectEnteringInfluence(this);
3804 } else {
3805 getControllingPlayer()->getEnergy()->objectLeavingInfluence(this);
3806 }
3807}
3808
3812
3813//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3814void Object::onDisabledEdge(Bool becomingDisabled)
3815{
3816 // rip through the behavior modules and call the onDisabledEdge for any modules that care
3817 for( BehaviorModule **module = m_behaviors; *module; ++module )
3818 (*module)->onDisabledEdge( becomingDisabled );
3819
3820 DozerAIInterface *dozerAI = getAI() ? getAI()->getDozerAIInterface() : NULL;
3821 if( becomingDisabled && dozerAI )
3822 {
3823 // Have to say goodbye to the thing we might be building or repairing so someone else can do it.
3824 if( dozerAI->getCurrentTask() != DOZER_TASK_INVALID )
3825 dozerAI->cancelTask( dozerAI->getCurrentTask() );
3826 }
3827
3828 Player* controller = getControllingPlayer();
3829 // can be called during game teardown, thus controller can be null
3830 if (controller)
3831 {
3832 //@todo jkmcd - Colin suggested we rewrite this to use the interface stuff. I agree, but need
3833 // to get some more bugs fixed today.
3834 static NameKeyType radar = NAMEKEY("RadarUpgrade");
3835 Module *mod = mod = findModule(radar);
3836 if (mod) {
3837 RadarUpgrade *radarMod = (RadarUpgrade*) mod;
3838 if (radarMod->isAlreadyUpgraded()) {
3839 // Need to decrement the count here, because we own a radar upgrade
3840 if (becomingDisabled) {
3841 controller->removeRadar(radarMod->getIsDisableProof());
3842 } else {
3843 controller->addRadar(radarMod->getIsDisableProof());
3844 }
3845 }
3846 }
3847 }
3848
3849 // We will need to adjust power ... somehow ...
3850 Int powerToAdjust = getTemplate()->getEnergyProduction();
3851
3852 if( powerToAdjust > 0 )
3853 {
3854 // We can't affect something that consumes, or else we go low power which removes the consumption
3855 // which makes us not low power so we add the consumption so we go low power...
3856 // This check also guaards the IsDisabled in friend_adjustPower above
3857 static NameKeyType powerPlant = NAMEKEY("PowerPlantUpgrade");
3858 static NameKeyType overCharge = NAMEKEY("OverchargeBehavior");
3859
3860 Module* mod = findModule(powerPlant);
3861 if (mod) {
3862 PowerPlantUpgrade *powerPlantMod = (PowerPlantUpgrade*) mod;
3863 if (powerPlantMod->isAlreadyUpgraded()) {
3864 powerToAdjust += getTemplate()->getEnergyBonus();
3865 }
3866 }
3867
3868 mod = findModule(overCharge);
3869 if (mod) {
3870 OverchargeBehavior *overChargeMod = (OverchargeBehavior*) mod;
3871 if (overChargeMod->isOverchargeActive()) {
3872 powerToAdjust += getTemplate()->getEnergyBonus();
3873 }
3874 }
3875
3876 // Now, adjust the power for the player.
3877 if (controller)
3878 controller->getEnergy()->adjustPower(powerToAdjust, !becomingDisabled);
3879 }
3880}
3881
3882//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3884//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3885void Object::crc( Xfer *xfer )
3886{
3887 // This is evil - we cast the const Matrix3D * to a Matrix3D * because the XferCRC class must use
3888 // the same interface as the XferLoad class for save game restore. This only works because
3889 // XferCRC does not modify its data.
3890
3891#ifdef DEBUG_CRC
3892// g_logObjectCRCs = TRUE;
3893// Bool g_logAllObjects = TRUE;
3894 AsciiString logString;
3895 AsciiString tmp;
3896 Bool doLogging = g_logObjectCRCs /* && getControllingPlayer()->getPlayerType() == PLAYER_HUMAN */;
3897 if (doLogging)
3898 {
3899 tmp.format("CRC of Object %d (%s), owned by player %d, ", m_id, getTemplate()->getName().str(), getControllingPlayer()->getPlayerIndex());
3900 logString.concat(tmp);
3901 }
3902#endif DEBUG_CRC
3903
3904 xfer->xferUnsignedByte(&m_privateStatus);
3905#ifdef DEBUG_CRC
3906 if (doLogging)
3907 {
3908 tmp.format("m_privateStatus: %X, ", (UnsignedInt)m_privateStatus);
3909 logString.concat(tmp);
3910 }
3911#endif // DEBUG_CRC
3912
3913 xfer->xferUser((Matrix3D *)getTransformMatrix(), sizeof(Matrix3D));
3914#ifdef DEBUG_CRC
3915 if (doLogging)
3916 {
3917 XferCRC tmpXfer;
3918 tmpXfer.open("tmp");
3919 tmpXfer.xferUser((Matrix3D *)getTransformMatrix(), sizeof(Matrix3D));
3920 tmp.format("getTransformMatrix(): %8.8X, ", tmpXfer.getCRC());
3921 tmpXfer.close();
3922 logString.concat(tmp);
3923 }
3924#endif DEBUG_CRC
3925
3926
3927#ifdef DEBUG_CRC
3928 if (doLogging)
3929 {
3930 const Matrix3D *mtx = getTransformMatrix();
3931 CRCDEBUG_LOG(("CRC of Object %d (%s), owned by player %d, ", m_id, getTemplate()->getName().str(), getControllingPlayer()->getPlayerIndex()));
3932 DUMPMATRIX3D(mtx);
3933 }
3934#endif DEBUG_CRC
3935
3936
3937
3938
3939
3940
3941
3942
3943
3944
3945
3946 xfer->xferUser(&m_id, sizeof(m_id));
3947#ifdef DEBUG_CRC
3948 if (doLogging)
3949 {
3950 tmp.format("m_id: %d, ", m_id);
3951 logString.concat(tmp);
3952 }
3953#endif DEBUG_CRC
3954 xfer->xferUser(&m_objectUpgradesCompleted, sizeof(Int64));
3955#ifdef DEBUG_CRC
3956 if (doLogging)
3957 {
3958 tmp.format("m_objectUpgradesCompleted: %I64X, ", m_objectUpgradesCompleted);
3959 logString.concat(tmp);
3960 }
3961#endif DEBUG_CRC
3962 if (m_experienceTracker)
3963 xfer->xferSnapshot( m_experienceTracker );
3964#ifdef DEBUG_CRC
3965 if (doLogging)
3966 {
3967 XferCRC tmpXfer;
3968 tmpXfer.open("tmp");
3969 tmpXfer.xferSnapshot(m_experienceTracker);
3970 tmp.format("m_experienceTracker: %8.8X, ", tmpXfer.getCRC());
3971 tmpXfer.close();
3972 logString.concat(tmp);
3973 }
3974#endif DEBUG_CRC
3975
3976 Real health = getBodyModule()->getHealth();
3977 xfer->xferUser(&health, sizeof(health));
3978#ifdef DEBUG_CRC
3979 if (doLogging)
3980 {
3981 tmp.format("health: %g/%8.8X, ", health, AS_INT(health));
3982 logString.concat(tmp);
3983 }
3984#endif DEBUG_CRC
3985
3986 xfer->xferUnsignedInt(&m_weaponBonusCondition);
3987#ifdef DEBUG_CRC
3988 if (doLogging)
3989 {
3990 tmp.format("m_weaponBonusCondition: %8.8X, ", m_weaponBonusCondition);
3991 logString.concat(tmp);
3992 }
3993#endif DEBUG_CRC
3994
3995 Real scalar = getBodyModule()->getDamageScalar();
3996 xfer->xferUser(&scalar, sizeof(scalar));
3997#ifdef DEBUG_CRC
3998 if (doLogging)
3999 {
4000 tmp.format("damage scalar: %g/%8.8X\n", scalar, AS_INT(scalar));
4001 logString.concat(tmp);
4002
4003 CRCDEBUG_LOG(("%s", logString.str()));
4004 }
4005#endif DEBUG_CRC
4006
4007 for (Int i=0; i<WEAPONSLOT_COUNT; ++i)
4008 {
4009 Weapon *thisWeapon = getWeaponInWeaponSlot((WeaponSlotType)i);
4010 if (thisWeapon)
4011 {
4012 xfer->xferSnapshot( thisWeapon );
4013 }
4014 }
4015
4016} // end crc
4017
4018//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4031//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4032void Object::xfer( Xfer *xfer )
4033{
4034
4035 // version
4036 const XferVersion currentVersion = 9;
4037 XferVersion version = currentVersion;
4038 xfer->xferVersion( &version, currentVersion );
4039
4040 // object ID
4041 ObjectID id = getID();
4042 xfer->xferObjectID( &id );
4043 setID( id );
4044
4045 DEBUG_LOG(("Xfer Object %s id=%d\n",getTemplate()->getName().str(),id));
4046
4047 if (version >= 7)
4048 {
4049 Matrix3D mtx = *getTransformMatrix();
4050 xfer->xferMatrix3D(&mtx);
4051 setTransformMatrix(&mtx);
4052 }
4053 else
4054 {
4055 // object position
4056 Coord3D pos = *getPosition();
4057 xfer->xferCoord3D( &pos );
4058 setPosition( &pos );
4059
4060 // orientation
4061 Real orientation = getOrientation();
4062 xfer->xferReal( &orientation );
4063 setOrientation( orientation );
4064 }
4065
4066 // team
4067 TeamID teamID = m_team ? m_team->getID() : TEAM_ID_INVALID;
4068 xfer->xferUser( &teamID, sizeof( TeamID ) );
4069 // DON'T set the team yet; must wait till we read our status bits,
4070 // since setTeam can affect the player's power usage, but that could
4071 // be done incorrectly if our status bits aren't accurate yet... (srj)
4072
4073 // producer id
4074 xfer->xferObjectID( &m_producerID );
4075
4076 // builder id
4077 xfer->xferObjectID( &m_builderID );
4078
4079 // drawable id
4080 Drawable *draw = getDrawable();
4081 DrawableID drawableID = draw ? draw->getID() : INVALID_DRAWABLE_ID;
4082 xfer->xferDrawableID( &drawableID );
4083 if( xfer->getXferMode() == XFER_LOAD )
4084 {
4085
4086 // change the ID of the drawable attached to be the same ID as it was when it was saved
4087 draw->setID( drawableID );
4088
4089 } // end if
4090
4091 // internal name
4092 xfer->xferAsciiString( &m_name );
4093
4094 // status
4095 if( version >= 8 )
4096 {
4097 m_status.xfer( xfer );
4098 }
4099 else
4100 {
4101 //We are loading an old version, so we must convert it from a 32-bit int to a bitflag
4102 UnsignedInt oldStatus;
4103 xfer->xferUnsignedInt( &oldStatus );
4104
4105 //Clear our status
4106 m_status.clear();
4107
4108 for( int i = 0; i < 32; i++ )
4109 {
4110 UnsignedInt bit = 1<<i;
4111 if( oldStatus & bit )
4112 {
4113 ObjectStatusTypes status = (ObjectStatusTypes)(i+1);
4114 m_status.set( MAKE_OBJECT_STATUS_MASK( status ) );
4115 }
4116 }
4117 }
4118
4119 // script status
4120 xfer->xferUnsignedByte( &m_scriptStatus );
4121
4122 // private status
4123 xfer->xferUnsignedByte( &m_privateStatus );
4124
4125 // OK, now that we have xferred our status bits, it's safe to set the team...
4126 if( xfer->getXferMode() == XFER_LOAD )
4127 {
4128 Team *team = TheTeamFactory->findTeamByID( teamID );
4129 if( team == NULL )
4130 {
4131 DEBUG_CRASH(( "Object::xfer - Unable to load team\n" ));
4132 throw SC_INVALID_DATA;
4133 }
4134 const Bool restoring = true;
4135 setOrRestoreTeam( team, restoring );
4136 }
4137
4138 // geometry info
4139 xfer->xferSnapshot( &m_geometryInfo );
4140
4141 // sighting info, last look - must be saved cause we save PartitionCell::m_shroudLevel
4142 xfer->xferSnapshot( m_partitionLastLook );
4143
4144 if( version >= 9 )
4145 xfer->xferSnapshot( m_partitionRevealAllLastLook );
4146
4147 // sighting info, last shroud - must be saved cause we save PartitionCell::m_shroudLevel
4148 xfer->xferSnapshot( m_partitionLastShroud );
4149
4150 // vision spied by
4151 xfer->xferUser( m_visionSpiedBy, sizeof( Int ) * MAX_PLAYER_COUNT );
4152
4153 // vision spied by mask
4154 xfer->xferUser( &m_visionSpiedMask, sizeof( PlayerMaskType ) );
4155
4156 // sighting info, last threat
4157 // John M says we don't need to save this (CBD)
4158// xfer->xferSnapshot( &m_partitionLastThreat );
4159
4160 // sighting info, last value
4161 // John M says we don't need to save this (CBD)
4162// xfer->xferSnapshot( &m_partitionLastValue );
4163
4164 // vision range
4165 xfer->xferReal( &m_visionRange );
4166
4167 // shroud clearing range
4168 xfer->xferReal( &m_shroudClearingRange );
4169
4170 // shroud range
4171 xfer->xferReal( &m_shroudRange );
4172
4173 // disabled mask
4174 m_disabledMask.xfer( xfer );
4175
4176 //New var added for version 2. Determines if the single use command button has been used or not.
4177 if( xfer->getXferMode() == XFER_SAVE || version >= 2 )
4178 {
4179 xfer->xferBool( &m_singleUseCommandUsed );
4180 }
4181 else
4182 {
4183 m_singleUseCommandUsed = false;
4184 }
4185
4186 // disabled till frame
4187 xfer->xferUser( m_disabledTillFrame, sizeof( UnsignedInt ) * DISABLED_COUNT );
4188
4189 // special model condition until
4190 xfer->xferUnsignedInt( &m_smcUntil );
4191
4192 //
4193 // radar data ... when loading, we will remove all objects from the radar and let
4194 // the radar system load itself as a separate chunk of data from the save file
4195 //
4196 if( xfer->getXferMode() == XFER_LOAD && m_radarData )
4197 TheRadar->removeObject( this );
4198
4199 // experience tracker
4200 xfer->xferSnapshot( m_experienceTracker );
4201
4202 //
4203 // we do not need to do anything with our m_containedBy pointer, the post process
4204 // of that objects contain module will actually re-do the contain process again
4205 //
4206 // m_containedBy <-- do nothing with this right now
4207 if( version >= 6 )
4208 {
4209 // No, the contain module is just going to friend_ reach in and set this for us.
4210 // Containers more complicated than Open (like Tunnel) can't do that. Our variable,
4211 // our responsibility.
4212 if( xfer->getXferMode() == XFER_SAVE )
4213 {
4214 if( m_containedBy != NULL )
4215 m_xferContainedByID = m_containedBy->getID();
4216 else
4217 m_xferContainedByID = INVALID_ID;
4218 }
4219
4220
4221 xfer->xferObjectID( &m_xferContainedByID );
4222 }
4223
4224 // contained by frame
4225 xfer->xferUnsignedInt( &m_containedByFrame );
4226
4227 // construction percent
4228 xfer->xferReal( &m_constructionPercent );
4229
4230 // upgrades completed
4231 xfer->xferUpgradeMask( &m_objectUpgradesCompleted );
4232
4233 // original team name
4234 xfer->xferAsciiString( &m_originalTeamName );
4235
4236 // indicator color
4237 xfer->xferColor( &m_indicatorColor );
4238
4239 // health box offset
4240 xfer->xferCoord3D( &m_healthBoxOffset );
4241
4242 // Entered & exited housekeeping.
4243 Int i;
4244 xfer->xferByte(&m_numTriggerAreasActive);
4245 xfer->xferUnsignedInt(&m_enteredOrExitedFrame);
4246 xfer->xferICoord3D(&m_iPos);
4247 if (m_numTriggerAreasActive<0 || m_numTriggerAreasActive>MAX_TRIGGER_AREA_INFOS) {
4248 DEBUG_CRASH(("Invalid m_numTriggerAreasActive = %d, max is %d", m_numTriggerAreasActive,
4249 MAX_TRIGGER_AREA_INFOS));
4250 throw SC_INVALID_DATA;
4251 }
4252 for (i=0; i<m_numTriggerAreasActive; i++) {
4253 AsciiString triggerName;
4254 if (m_triggerInfo[i].pTrigger) {
4255 triggerName = m_triggerInfo[i].pTrigger->getTriggerName();
4256 }
4257 xfer->xferAsciiString(&triggerName);
4258 if (xfer->getXferMode() == XFER_LOAD)
4259 {
4260 //
4261 // CBD (11-13-2002) I'm disabling this because it appears there might be some areas with
4262 // empty names, see John A. for more info
4263 //
4264 //if (triggerName.isNotEmpty())
4265 m_triggerInfo[i].pTrigger = TheTerrainLogic->getTriggerAreaByName(triggerName);
4266 }
4267 xfer->xferByte(&m_triggerInfo[i].entered);
4268 xfer->xferByte(&m_triggerInfo[i].exited);
4269 xfer->xferByte(&m_triggerInfo[i].isInside);
4270 }
4271 // Layer object is pathing on.
4272 xfer->xferUser(&m_layer, sizeof(m_layer));
4273
4274 // Layer of current path goal.
4275 xfer->xferUser(&m_destinationLayer, sizeof(m_destinationLayer));
4276
4277 // Object selectability.
4278 xfer->xferBool(&m_isSelectable);
4279
4280 xfer->xferUnsignedInt(&m_safeOcclusionFrame);
4281
4282 // User formations.
4283 xfer->xferUser(&m_formationID, sizeof(m_formationID));
4284 if (m_formationID!=NO_FORMATION_ID) {
4285 xfer->xferCoord2D(&m_formationOffset);
4286 }
4287
4288 // module count
4289 UnsignedShort moduleCount = 0;
4290 for (BehaviorModule** b = m_behaviors; *b; ++b)
4291 ++moduleCount;
4292
4293 xfer->xferUnsignedShort( &moduleCount );
4294 AsciiString moduleIdentifier;
4295 BehaviorModule *module;
4296 if( xfer->getXferMode() == XFER_SAVE )
4297 {
4298
4299 // go through all modules
4300 for (BehaviorModule** b = m_behaviors; *b; ++b)
4301 {
4302
4303 // get module
4304 module = *b;
4305
4306 // write module identifier
4307 moduleIdentifier = TheNameKeyGenerator->keyToName( module->getModuleTagNameKey() );
4308 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH( moduleIdentifier != AsciiString::TheEmptyString,
4309 ("Object::xfer - Module tag key does not translate to a string!\n") );
4310 xfer->xferAsciiString( &moduleIdentifier );
4311
4312 // begin a data block
4313 xfer->beginBlock();
4314
4315 // xfer data
4316 xfer->xferSnapshot( module );
4317
4318 // end data block
4319 xfer->endBlock();
4320
4321 } // end for, it
4322
4323 } // end if, save
4324 else
4325 {
4326 AsciiString otherModuleIdentifier;
4327
4328 // read all module data
4329 for( UnsignedShort i = 0; i < moduleCount; ++i )
4330 {
4331
4332 // read module name
4333 xfer->xferAsciiString( &moduleIdentifier );
4334 NameKeyType moduleIdentifierKey = TheNameKeyGenerator->nameToKey(moduleIdentifier);
4335
4336 // find the module with this identifier in the module list
4337 module = NULL;
4338 for (BehaviorModule** b = m_behaviors; b && *b; ++b)
4339 {
4340
4341 if (moduleIdentifierKey == (*b)->getModuleTagNameKey())
4342 {
4343 module = *b;
4344 break;
4345 }
4346
4347 } // end for, moduleIt
4348
4349 // start of a new block
4350 Int dataSize = xfer->beginBlock();
4351
4352 //
4353 // if we didn't find the module, it's quite possible that we have removed
4354 // it from the object definition in a future patch, if that is so, we need to
4355 // skip the module data in the file
4356 //
4357 if( module == NULL )
4358 {
4359
4360 // for testing purposes, this module better be found
4361// DEBUG_CRASH(( "Object::xfer - Module '%s' was indicated in file, but not found on object '%s'(%d)\n",
4362// moduleIdentifier.str(), getTemplate()->getName().str(), getID() ));
4363
4364 // skip this data in the file
4365 xfer->skip( dataSize );
4366
4367 } // end if
4368 else
4369 {
4370
4371 // xfer the data into this module
4372 xfer->xferSnapshot( module );
4373
4374 } // end else
4375
4376 // end block
4377 xfer->endBlock();
4378
4379 } // end for, i module count recorded in file
4380
4381 } // end else, load
4382
4383
4384 if ( version >= 3 )
4385 {
4386 xfer->xferObjectID( &m_soleHealingBenefactorID );
4387 xfer->xferUnsignedInt( &m_soleHealingBenefactorExpirationFrame );
4388 }
4389 else if ( xfer->getXferMode() == XFER_LOAD )
4390 {
4391 m_soleHealingBenefactorID = INVALID_ID;
4392 m_soleHealingBenefactorExpirationFrame = 0;
4393 }
4394
4395 // Doesn't need to be saved. These are created as needed. jba.
4396 //AIGroup* m_group; ///< if non-NULL, we are part of this group of agents
4397
4398 // don't need to save m_partitionData.
4399 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(!(xfer->getXferMode() == XFER_LOAD && m_partitionData == NULL), ("should not be in partitionmgr yet"));
4400
4401 // don't need to be saved or loaded; are inited & cached for runtime only by our ctor (srj)
4402 //m_repulsorHelper;
4403 //m_smcHelper;
4404 //m_wsHelper;
4405 //m_defectionHelper;
4406 //m_firingTracker;
4407 //m_contain;
4408 //m_body;
4409 //m_ai;
4410 //m_physics;
4411#if defined(_DEBUG) || defined(_INTERNAL)
4412 //m_hasDiedAlready;
4413#endif
4414
4415 if (version >= 4)
4416 {
4417 // xfer the weaponSetFlags FIRST, since we need 'em to restore the weaponSet properly. (srj)
4418 m_curWeaponSetFlags.xfer( xfer );
4419 xfer->xferUnsignedInt(&m_weaponBonusCondition);
4420 xfer->xferUser(&m_lastWeaponCondition, sizeof(m_lastWeaponCondition));
4421
4422 // do the weaponSet itself after all the weapon-related stuff, just in case
4423 xfer->xferSnapshot(&m_weaponSet);
4424
4425 m_specialPowerBits.xfer( xfer );
4426
4427 xfer->xferAsciiString(&m_commandSetStringOverride);
4428
4429 xfer->xferBool(&m_modulesReady);
4430 }
4431
4432 if (version >= 5)
4433 {
4434 xfer->xferBool(&m_isReceivingDifficultyBonus);
4435 }
4436 else
4437 m_isReceivingDifficultyBonus = FALSE;
4438
4439} // end xfer
4440
4441//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4443//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4444void Object::loadPostProcess()
4445{
4446 if( m_xferContainedByID != INVALID_ID )
4447 m_containedBy = TheGameLogic->findObjectByID(m_xferContainedByID);
4448 else
4449 m_containedBy = NULL;
4450
4451} // end loadPostProcess
4452
4453//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4455//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4456Bool Object::hasUpgrade( const UpgradeTemplate *upgradeT ) const
4457{
4458 if( m_objectUpgradesCompleted.testForAll( upgradeT->getUpgradeMask() ) )
4459 {
4460 return TRUE;
4461 }
4462 return FALSE;
4463} // end hasUpgrade
4464
4465//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4467//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4468Bool Object::affectedByUpgrade( const UpgradeTemplate *upgradeT ) const
4469{
4470 UpgradeMaskType objectMask = getObjectCompletedUpgradeMask();
4471 UpgradeMaskType playerMask = getControllingPlayer()->getCompletedUpgradeMask();
4472 UpgradeMaskType maskToCheck = playerMask;
4473 maskToCheck.set( objectMask );
4474 maskToCheck.set( upgradeT->getUpgradeMask() );
4475
4476 // We need to add in all of the already owned upgrades to handle "AND" requiring upgrades.
4477 // We combine all the masks in case someone has a Object AND Player combination
4478
4479 for (BehaviorModule** module = m_behaviors; *module; ++module)
4480 {
4481 UpgradeModuleInterface* upgrade = (*module)->getUpgrade();
4482 if (!upgrade)
4483 continue;
4484
4485 if( upgrade->wouldUpgrade( maskToCheck ) )
4486 {
4487 // if any of my many upgrade modules would execute in response to this flag, say yes.
4488 return TRUE;
4489 }
4490 }
4491 return FALSE;
4492
4493} // end affectedByUpgrade
4494
4495//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4497//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4498void Object::giveUpgrade( const UpgradeTemplate *upgradeT )
4499{
4500 if (upgradeT)
4501 {
4502 m_objectUpgradesCompleted.set( upgradeT->getUpgradeMask() );
4503
4504 //
4505 // iterate through all the upgrade modules of this object and call the method to
4506 // grant a new upgrade
4507 //
4508 updateUpgradeModules();
4509 }
4510} // end giveUpgrade
4511
4512//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4514//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4515void Object::removeUpgrade( const UpgradeTemplate *upgradeT )
4516{
4517 m_objectUpgradesCompleted.clear( upgradeT->getUpgradeMask() );
4518 for (BehaviorModule** module = m_behaviors; *module; ++module)
4519 {
4520 UpgradeModuleInterface* upgrade = (*module)->getUpgrade();
4521 if (!upgrade)
4522 continue;
4523
4524 // Whoa, please note that while the function is called Object::RemoveUpgrade, it is not removing anything
4525 // in the sense of undoing the effects. It is just resetting the upgrade so it may be run again.
4526 upgrade->resetUpgrade( upgradeT->getUpgradeMask() );
4527 }
4528}
4529
4530//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4532//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4533void Object::onCapture( Player *oldOwner, Player *newOwner )
4534{
4535 // Everybody dhills when they captured so they don't keep doing something the new player might not want him to be doing
4536 if( getAIUpdateInterface() && (oldOwner != newOwner) )
4537 getAIUpdateInterface()->aiIdle(CMD_FROM_AI);
4538
4539 // this gets the new owner some points
4540 newOwner->getScoreKeeper()->addObjectCaptured(this);
4541
4542 // rip through the behavior modules and call the onCapture for any modules that care
4543 for( BehaviorModule **module = m_behaviors; *module; ++module )
4544 (*module)->onCapture( oldOwner, newOwner );
4545
4546 //
4547 // We have to undo our look for the old team and redo it for the new.
4548 // onCapture is used now, so it better be called after ownership changes and not before.
4549 //
4550 handlePartitionCellMaintenance();
4551
4552 // Design needs the player to be able to sell buildings he steals from the AI's build list, and this is the
4553 // easiest fix. The only snafu would be a key building build listed by the AI that the player can capture
4554 // and the AI tries to capture back but needs to not sell. In that case, a Cinematic Unsellable version
4555 // of the building needs to be made. This fix has been okayed as the most non-lethal in November.
4556 clearScriptStatus(OBJECT_STATUS_SCRIPT_UNSELLABLE);
4557
4558 // mark the command bar to redraw
4559 TheControlBar->markUIDirty();
4560
4561 if (oldOwner!=newOwner && newOwner->isSkirmishAIPlayer()) {
4562 // The skirmish ai doesn't know what to do with captured faction buildings except sell them.
4563 if (isFactionStructure()) {
4564 TheBuildAssistant->sellObject( this );
4565 }
4566 }
4567
4568} // end onCapture
4569
4570//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4572void Object::onDie( DamageInfo *damageInfo )
4573{
4574
4575 checkAndDetonateBoobyTrap(NULL);// Already dying, so no need to handle death case of explosion
4576
4577#if defined(_DEBUG) || defined(_INTERNAL)
4578 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(m_hasDiedAlready == false, ("Object::onDie has been called multiple times. This is invalid. jkmcd"));
4579 m_hasDiedAlready = true;
4580#endif
4581
4582 Bool selfInflicted = (damageInfo->in.m_sourceID == getID());
4583
4584 // FIRST, call our die modules.
4585 for (BehaviorModule** d = m_behaviors; *d; ++d)
4586 {
4587 DieModuleInterface* die = (*d)->getDie();
4588 if (die)
4589 die->onDie(damageInfo);
4590 }
4591
4592 // When objects die we remove from the radar as they're really not interesting anymore
4593 if( m_radarData )
4594 TheRadar->removeObject( this );
4595
4596 // Just in case I have been sporting one of thise fancy Terrain Decals,
4597 //I naturally lose it now, because I'm dead.
4598 Drawable *draw = getDrawable();
4599 if (draw) draw->setTerrainDecalFadeTarget(0.0f, -0.03f);//fade...
4600 //if (draw) draw->setTerrainDecal(TERRAIN_DECAL_NONE);//pop!
4601
4602
4603 // objects that were spawned from something, need to tell their spawner that they have died
4604 Object* spawner = TheGameLogic->findObjectByID( getProducerID() );
4605 if( spawner )
4606 {
4607
4608 // get the spawn behavior interface of the spawner
4609 SpawnBehaviorInterface *spawnerBehavior = spawner->getSpawnBehaviorInterface();
4610 if( spawnerBehavior )
4611 spawnerBehavior->onSpawnDeath( getID(), damageInfo );
4612
4613 }
4614
4615 handlePartitionCellMaintenance();
4616 if(m_team)
4617 m_team->notifyTeamOfObjectDeath();
4618
4619 if (isLocallyControlled() && !selfInflicted) // wasLocallyControlled? :-)
4620 {
4621 if (isKindOf(KINDOF_STRUCTURE) && isKindOf(KINDOF_MP_COUNT_FOR_VICTORY))
4622 {
4623 TheEva->setShouldPlay(EVA_BuldingLost);
4624 }
4625 else if (isKindOf(KINDOF_INFANTRY) || isKindOf(KINDOF_VEHICLE))
4626 {
4627 TheEva->setShouldPlay(EVA_UnitLost);
4628 //Create a fake radar event so the user can use the spacebar to quickly jump to this!
4629 TheRadar->tryEvent( RADAR_EVENT_FAKE, getPosition() );
4630 }
4631 }
4632
4633 // This call won't do anything if we aren't actually in the list.
4634 //Kris: Added NULL check to prevent crash with combat bikes & their riders getting deleted on exit.
4635 if( getControllingPlayer() )
4636 {
4637 TheInGameUI->removeIdleWorker( this, getControllingPlayer()->getPlayerIndex() );
4638 }
4639
4640 //When a GLA hole is in the process of rebuilding, and that rebuild is lost, we need to
4641 //tell anyone attacking it to transfer the attack to the hole that still exists.
4642 if( testStatus( OBJECT_STATUS_RECONSTRUCTING ) )
4643 {
4644 Object *hole = TheGameLogic->findObjectByID( getProducerID() );
4645 if( hole )
4646 {
4647 // set the information in the hole about what to build
4648 RebuildHoleBehaviorInterface *rhbi = RebuildHoleBehavior::getRebuildHoleBehaviorInterfaceFromObject( hole );
4649
4650 // sanity
4651 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH( rhbi, ("Object::onDie() - No Rebuild Hole Behavior interface on hole\n") );
4652
4653 // start the rebuild process
4654 if( rhbi )
4655 {
4656 rhbi->startRebuildProcess( getTemplate(), getID() );
4657 }
4658
4659 //Transfer any attackers from the destroyed building to the hole.
4660 for ( Object *obj = TheGameLogic->getFirstObject(); obj; obj = obj->getNextObject() )
4661 {
4662 AIUpdateInterface* ai = obj->getAI();
4663 if (!ai)
4664 continue;
4665
4666 ai->transferAttack( getID(), hole->getID() );
4667 }
4668 }
4669 }
4670
4671}
4672
4673//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4674void Object::setWeaponBonusCondition(WeaponBonusConditionType wst)
4675{
4676 WeaponBonusConditionFlags oldCondition = m_weaponBonusCondition;
4677 m_weaponBonusCondition |= (1 << wst);
4678
4679 if( oldCondition != m_weaponBonusCondition )
4680 {
4681 // Our weapon bonus just changed, so we need to immediately update our weapons
4682 m_weaponSet.weaponSetOnWeaponBonusChange(this);
4683 }
4684}
4685
4686//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4687void Object::clearWeaponBonusCondition(WeaponBonusConditionType wst)
4688{
4689 WeaponBonusConditionFlags oldCondition = m_weaponBonusCondition;
4690 m_weaponBonusCondition &= ~(1 << wst);
4691
4692 if( oldCondition != m_weaponBonusCondition )
4693 {
4694 // Our weapon bonus just changed, so we need to immediately update our weapons
4695 m_weaponSet.weaponSetOnWeaponBonusChange(this);
4696 }
4697}
4698
4699//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4706//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4707void Object::adjustModelConditionForWeaponStatus()
4708{
4709 UnsignedInt now = TheGameLogic->getFrame();
4710
4711 for (int i = 0; i < WEAPONSLOT_COUNT; ++i)
4712 {
4713 const Weapon* w = m_weaponSet.getWeaponInWeaponSlot((WeaponSlotType)i);
4714 if (!w)
4715 {
4716 m_lastWeaponCondition[i] = WSF_NONE;
4717 continue;
4718 }
4719
4720 WeaponSetConditionType conditionToSet = WSF_INVALID;
4721 if (i != m_weaponSet.getCurWeaponSlot())
4722 {
4723 // if this isn't the current weapon, then we never set ANYTHING for it.
4724 conditionToSet = WSF_NONE;
4725 }
4726 else if (w->getLastShotFrame() == now)
4727 {
4728 // yep, this overrides any weapon-status condition!
4729 conditionToSet = WSF_FIRING;
4730 }
4731 else if (!testStatus( OBJECT_STATUS_IS_ATTACKING ))
4732 {
4733 // srj sez: not 100% sure about this one, but the problem is: say we were attacking,
4734 // then issue a move command. if we didn't do this here, we might still have a 'firing'
4735 // pose, because his weapon might be in 'reloading' mode. since we're not attacking, however,
4736 // we really don't care, so we just force the issue here. (This might still need tweaking for the pursue state.)
4737 conditionToSet = WSF_NONE;
4738 }
4739 else
4740 {
4741 WeaponStatus newStatus = w->getStatus();
4742
4743 const static WeaponSetConditionType s_wsfLookup[WEAPON_STATUS_COUNT] =
4744 {
4745 WSF_NONE, // READY_TO_FIRE,
4746 WSF_NONE, // OUT_OF_AMMO,
4747 WSF_BETWEEN, // BETWEEN_FIRING_SHOTS,
4748 WSF_RELOADING, // RELOADING_CLIP,
4749 WSF_PREATTACK // PRE_ATTACK,
4750 };
4751 conditionToSet = s_wsfLookup[newStatus];
4752
4753 // special case this: say we are firing in bursts: pow-pow-pow-pause, etc.
4754 // then we might have a frame where we have reloaded and are ready-to-fire,
4755 // but haven't fired yet this frame. in that case, use 'between' so we still have
4756 // a firing pose, 'cuz if we use 'none' we will 'pop' back to idle for a frame. (srj)
4757 // additional note: only do if aiming or firing, since we could also be in this state if
4758 // we are approaching or pursuing a target! (srj)
4759 if (newStatus == READY_TO_FIRE && conditionToSet == WSF_NONE && testStatus( OBJECT_STATUS_IS_ATTACKING ) &&
4760 (testStatus( OBJECT_STATUS_IS_AIMING_WEAPON ) || testStatus( OBJECT_STATUS_IS_FIRING_WEAPON )))
4761 {
4762 conditionToSet = WSF_BETWEEN;
4763 }
4764
4765 }
4766
4767 if (m_drawable)
4768 {
4769 m_drawable->updateDrawableClipStatus( w->getRemainingAmmo(), w->getClipSize(), w->getWeaponSlot() );
4770 if (conditionToSet != WSF_INVALID && conditionToSet != m_lastWeaponCondition[i])
4771 {
4772 m_lastWeaponCondition[i] = conditionToSet;
4773 ModelConditionFlags c = m_weaponSet.getModelConditionForWeaponSlot((WeaponSlotType)i, conditionToSet);
4774 m_drawable->clearAndSetModelConditionFlags(s_allWeaponFireFlags[i], c);
4775 if (conditionToSet == WSF_PREATTACK)
4776 {
4777 // in the preattack state, adjust the speed of the preattack anim to match the actual time it will take
4778 UnsignedInt preAttackDone = w->getPreAttackFinishedFrame();
4779 if (preAttackDone > now)
4780 m_drawable->setAnimationLoopDuration(preAttackDone - now);
4781 }
4782 }
4783 }
4784 }
4785}
4786
4787//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4789void Object::onPartitionCellChange()
4790{
4791 handlePartitionCellMaintenance();
4792}
4793
4794//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4795void Object::handlePartitionCellMaintenance()
4796{
4797 handleShroud();
4798 handleValueMap();
4799 handleThreatMap();
4800}
4801
4802//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4803void Object::handleShroud()
4804{
4805 // Undo last looking
4806 unlook();
4807 // and shrouding
4808 unshroud();
4809
4810 // redo shrouding
4811 shroud();
4812 // Redo looking
4813 look();
4814}
4815
4816//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4817void Object::handleValueMap()
4818{
4819 removeValue();
4820 addValue();
4821}
4822
4823//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4824void Object::handleThreatMap()
4825{
4826 removeThreat();
4827 addThreat();
4828}
4829
4830//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4831void Object::addValue()
4832{
4833 if( !m_partitionLastValue->isInvalid() )
4834 {
4835 DEBUG_CRASH( ("An Object is adding value, but hasn't removed his previous value.") );
4836 return;
4837 }
4838
4839 if (!getControllingPlayer())
4840 return;
4841
4842 if( getStatusBits().test( OBJECT_STATUS_UNDER_CONSTRUCTION ) || isEffectivelyDead() || getShroudClearingRange() <= 0.0f )
4843 return;
4844
4845
4846 m_partitionLastValue->m_where = *getPosition();
4847 m_partitionLastValue->m_data = getTemplate()->friend_getBuildCost();
4848
4849 m_partitionLastValue->m_forWhom = getControllingPlayer()->getPlayerMask();
4850 m_partitionLastValue->m_howFar = getVisionRange(); // we are valuable all the way to where we can target.
4851
4852 ThePartitionManager->doValueAffect(m_partitionLastValue->m_where.x,
4853 m_partitionLastValue->m_where.y,
4854 m_partitionLastValue->m_howFar,
4855 m_partitionLastValue->m_data,
4856 m_partitionLastValue->m_forWhom
4857 );
4858}
4859
